themes: Lack of awareness about grant opportunities among artists
Complexity and discouragement in the grant application process
Funding programs favoring musicians and traditional visual artists over filmmakers
Financial precarity and self-funding among filmmakers
Film's broad community and economic impact
key_phrases: About 90% of the artists I speak with have never even heard of these grants
the process is so complex and discouraging that they'd rather fund their projects out of pocket
Most grant opportunities are tailored to musicians, traditional visual artists, or performers, leaving filmmakers overlooked
filmmakers to assume they'll need to crowdfund, scrape together personal savings, and juggle multiple jobs just to survive and create
building small, self-sustaining artistic communities with almost no institutional support
Film is one of the only art forms that requires a truly diverse village to bring it to life
Few other art forms mobilize such a broad and inclusive community
barriers_identified: Lack of awareness of grant opportunities
Funding programs not tailored to filmmakers
Financial burden on filmmakers to self-fund projects
Lack of institutional support for filmmakers
